LEO PRIME stood looking at NIGHTLIGH=
T=92s door - He had come looking for
NIGHTLIGHT and instead heard ELITA=92s=
 calls for her mother and the
general response. He could hear the voices on=
 the other side of the
door as clearly hearing a conversation next to him, =
his own heightened
senses serving him in ways he had not intended.

He frow=
ned as they talked. They were evidently trying to help ELITA,
but he knew t=
hat if TUSCON was in the jungle he was far too far away
to help anyone righ=
t now, and if the jungle was as dangerous as the
report had received from P=
OLAR CLAW, the TUSCON had his own troubles
to worry about.

LEO pressed the=
 door buzzer. He hoped NIGHTLIGHT hadn=92t done what he
thought she had don=
e. =93Talon, Straightshot we need to talk.=94 He said
calmly, but with a ce=
rtain edge.
